requirements.description: Sentry collects data configured by the user, typically errors, API calls, page loads, or similar requests and responses.
By default, Sentry does not collect personally identifiable information (PII), but additional context and metadata can be included at the user's discretion.
Users have the option to include PII such as usernames, email addresses, or attach files like logs or crash reports to the data sent to Sentry.
Sentry processes the collected data to provide application monitoring services.
Users must disclose all data collection practices in their app's privacy policy, including the data sent to Sentry.
